metadata.synopsis: The player talks to Derryth after she returns from the Underdark, with or without the Noblestalk.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Use debug book --> set flags --> act 3, bonecloaks to chooe path.Head to Bonecloak's Apothecary (-26.995; 26.776; -38.02) and speak with Derryth, the dwarf behind the counter. OR Head to the Elfsong Tavern (59.447; 41.372; -2.144) and speak to Derryth there.oe: LOW_BaelenDead , LOW_BaelenHealed , LOW_GaveNoblestalk

9.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
9.text: Huh! Now there's a mug I won't soon forget.

138.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
138.text: How's that noblestalk treating you, eh? Better be good. 'Shroom's why our customers came. We're out on our arses soon enough without it, I hope you know.

72.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
72.text: Gee, thanks. Looks like you grew a conscience after all.
72.context: NodeContext: She's grateful but also annoyed with the player.

76.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
76.text: This'll help. I'll be able to propagate a fair few from this one, too. Come back another day and I may have some for you. At a fair price.

14.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
14.text: Look who it is! You're just in time - noblestalk's propagated a treat. Have a look.

21.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
21.text: Hey, you. Take a look at this cat. Does he look like a 'Harry' to you?

18.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
18.text: Bah! No it isn't. I'll call him... Walrus.

49.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
49.text: Livens the place up, doesn't he? Yes he does, indeed he does!
49.context: NodeContext: First bit to the player, second to the cat on the ground.

115.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
115.text: Please. It's a cat, not a clown. But he's no 'Harry' either, is he? I think I'll call him... Walrus.

123.speaker: Player
123.text: I don't care what you name your cat.

141.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
141.text: Suit yourself. Me and... Walrus - that suits you, doesn't it, you lovely thing? - don't need your help anyhow.

56.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
56.text: Bonecloak's. Get what you can before we have to shutter the place.

133.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
133.text: If you came for noblestalk, you're out of luck. Last trip to the Underdark was a miserable failure. Won't be able to keep the lamps lit much longer.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: As it happens, I already have some noblestalk to hand.

19.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
19.text: You... but... how?! Well... never mind how. Listen here: if you give me that mushroom, I'll propagate it to the Hells and back.

40.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
40.text: I'll give you a discount on everything here, and... well... you'll be keeping food in my mouth and a roof over my head for months.

54.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
54.text: I ain't a beggar. But. Please.
54.context: NodeContext: A hard woman softening out of necessity.

58.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
58.text: Cat's crabs, you've saved my arse. Come back tomorrow, hey? There'll be more of the stuff already. Grows like a weed in the right hands. And erm. Thank you. Very much.
58.context: NodeContext: Hardness returned to her, but she's happy now

135.speaker: Player
135.text: You sound like a beggar to me.

75.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
75.text: Maybe. But if you ever find yourself down on your luck, I hope you'll receive the same kindness I'm asking for now.

136.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
136.text: Well. You've every right to it. If you see me on the streets in future, throw me a copper or two, eh?

94.speaker: Player
94.text: You get your wares from the Underdark?

117.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
117.text: Only place to find our best-seller. Noblestalk's this place's bread and butter - milk and eggs, too. Without it, we're sunk.

62.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
62.text: What can I do you for?

37.speaker: Player
37.text: I'd like to give you that noblestalk.

65.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
65.context: NodeContext: She's unpleasant but she is glad to see you, in her way.

107.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
107.text: Welcome to Bonecloak's. Doors are still open thanks to that noblestalk you helped us with.
107.context: NodeContext: She's unpleasant but she is glad to see you, in her way.

20.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
20.text: We've even enough left over to keep ourselves fed. Not that Baelen's worth the gold it takes to keep him fattened up.
20.context: NodeContext: She's unpleasant but she is glad to see you, in her way.

53.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
53.text: Anyway. We can knock a little off the top if you've a mind to buy.
53.context: NodeContext: She's unpleasant but she is glad to see you, in her way.

116.speaker: Player
116.text: How are you and Baelen getting on?

48.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
48.text: He's wrecking my head, as always. Makes himself useful with a broom from time to time, at least.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: You might lighten up on Baelen. He seems harmless enough.

51.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
51.text: You don't know him like I do. He may play the lamb, but beneath it all, he's a black-hearted ogre. I got the scars to prove it.

55.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
55.text: Anyway. You ought to keep your nose in your own corner. You might upset folk.

68.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
68.text: Hope you're here to buy something.

69.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
69.text: Huh. It's you. I never forget a face.

59.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
59.text: Noblestalk is why the customers came. We were out on our arses soon enough without it. Too bad my worthless fella couldn't get one simple thing right in his life.

80.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
80.text: Get what you can while the getting's good. We'll be closing our doors soon enough.

104.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
104.text: We mostly trade in noblestalk, and my fool of a fella Baelen never came back with any.

118.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
118.text: If the old sack was going to die, he could've brought back some noblestalk beforehand. Without the bloody fungus, Bonecloak's days are numbered.

109.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
109.text: It's the least you could do.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: How are you getting along without Baelen?

108.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
108.text: Well. It's a lot quieter without him bumbling about the place. He was on the slow fade out anyway.

139.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
139.text: He was a terror most of his life, you know. Mean. Drunk. Got a few scars I could show you that'd make you wince.

73.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
73.text: When he got sick, I was grateful for the relief. But so angry, too.

10.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
10.text: We both of us deserved better than life gave us. Now he's off in the City of Judgement, probably wasting away unclaimed, the old heathen. And I'm here. Alone.

57.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
57.text: Just fine, now Walrus is here to keep me company. Isn't that right, precious?

98.speaker: Player
98.text: Are you glad to be back in Baldur's Gate?

120.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
120.text: Oh, sure. Cultists on the loose, a murderer hacking people to bits, and big metal freaks stomping hither, thither, and yon.

16.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
16.text: The place is in shambles, to be honest. But Walrus softens the blow.

121.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
121.text: That noblestalk you gave me helped, though. It's what keeps the customers coming. Bloody fungus is all that keeps our candles lit.

60.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
60.text: You could've done me a great turn with that noblestalk. It's what attracted the customers. Won't be able to keep the candles lit without it. Hope that pleases you.

81.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
81.text: Well! Aren't you a sight for sore eyes? Made it out of the Underdark in one piece, I see.
81.context: NodeContext: More jovial than usual. She's doing well.

17.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
17.text: I owe you a debt of gratitude, believe it or not. When you healed my husband, Baelen, I thought my life was over. Turns out it was just beginning.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: I met him in your shop. He seems to be doing well.

102.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
102.text: Happy as a pig in shit, I'm sure. Eighty years we've been married. Seventy of 'em, he was a mean, violent man who loved nothing but the drink.
102.context: NodeContext: With a scoff, bitterness in her voice.

106.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
106.text: Him losing his mind softened him and hardened me. I hated him so much - more than I knew a person could carry. And now I wasn't too scared to show it.

101.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
101.text: But it brought no relief. Not really. So when you turned him back, I turned mine.

4.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
4.text: I don't have much now. But a bit of peace is worth an awful lot.

112.speaker: Player
112.text: Glad to see you're doing well.

39.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
39.text: You know what? So am I. And I hope Baelen finds his peace while he still can, too.

64.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
64.text: It's nice to see a familiar face. After living a handsbreadth away from Baelen most of my life, I've forgotten how to be alone.
64.context: NodeContext: With a little sigh, reflecting.

36.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
36.text: Maybe I'll get to courting after a little while. Then again, maybe I'll just get a cat.

91.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
91.text: You take care now, all right? Be sure you do. Life's too short not to.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: I wish you both the best.

95.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
95.text: Thank you. Baelen won't agree with me, but I say we both deserve it.

110.speaker: Player
110.text: The two of you deserve each other.

5.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
5.context: NodeContext: With a little bit of humor. Player is being mean to her but she's not taking the bait.

119.speaker: Player
119.text: So he got well, and you left him?

89.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
89.text: Sure I did. Before he could do me any worse damage than he did for the first seventy years of our marriage.

129.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
129.text: Had to be practical about it. Slip out while he slept. I knew if I stayed there, it'd be the death of me.

41.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
41.text: Baelen made my life hell. And when I had the chance to return the favour, I took it. That's no way to live. Now we're both free.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: What will you do now that you're done with the shop?

2.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
2.text: The shop. The bloody shop. Thing was like a noose around my neck, getting tighter every day.

35.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
35.text: You don't realise how much your life is choking you until you can breathe again.

70.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
70.text: Turns out I didn't hate life. I hated that life.
70.context: NodeContext: She breathes in deeply through her nose, a sigh of contentment

42.speaker: Player
42.text: I admit, I was worried about the two of you.

124.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
124.text: You should've been. Baelen was an awful, violent man. Would've killed me if I stayed. And truth be told, if you hadn't healed him, I might've done the same to him.

93.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
93.text: I know you. So you made it out of the Underdark. More'n I can say for Baelen.

145.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
145.text: Huh! Now there's a mug I won't soon forget.
